title: A Place for All
review: Jaisalmer is a city where everyone can have a great time. Young, Adult or Old there is something for everyone here. The city has great Art and Architecture i.e. Forts , temples , Havelis etc, nice markets and plenty of nice restaurants and numerous activities to choose from. Its quite hard to get bored while you are here.

title: Jaisalmet is good city to Visit
review: This is a very small city but a very good place to visit. Best time to visit this place is during winters. however stay aware that the guides they cheat you and take a lot of money from your for the tours and stays. Must visit place once in the life time.

title: The Golden City
review: The golden city is one of precious gem of the Rajasthan State. The region of Thar has this beautiful Golden city located at the western shore of Rajasthan. The majestic forts, panoramic lake and beautiful sand land welcomes millions of tourists from around the globe. Traditional Rajasthani food, music, dance, desert safari, it has all the charm that one can wonder. The small town of Jaisalmer is very budget friendly, one can book a hotel room by paying just $4 or $5 for a day. Jaisalmer is very hot in summers, so if you wish to go there plan your trip from September to mid March. Three or Four days is sufficient to cover the entire region otherwise you can manage in two three days also. Try to be there while Desert festival or other regional festival. Do check festival details at Rajasthan Tourism website or you may search by Jaisalmer Festivals.

title: Interesting town to visit
review: Good place for tourist to explore the desert. We were here for 5 days to attend a destination wedding. Did the camel and Jeep rides and fort your. Not much time to do other activities

title: Nice little town with a rich history and near to border.
review: Really loved the city due to it's cultural and architectural history.Although the streets are not very clean still it has it's own charisma.

title: Golden city
review: An iconic ancient fort city. Hire a tour guide to help you wander around the alleys and learn the history of the city. The cost is around 10 euros for 3-4 hours. Wear your sneakers and watch out where step on. The guide will take you to the lake too.

title: City badly needs cleaning
review: Dear municipal corporation and newly elected MLA, kindly wake-up clean up the city from open drains, cow-dung, garbage

title: Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer is a nice place to visit if you are in Rajasthan. so many historic places, forts, palaces, museum are there. we have visited so many places here. even we had camel and jeep ride. enjoyed rajasthani folk dance.

title: Beautiful residential houses
review: Within the confines of the narrow streets of Jaisalmer fort area, these artful residential buildings stand out.

title: rajputana shaan
review: please visit ones in a life in jaisalmer

title: A thousand and one night fairytale
review: I pictured the town in my mind before my journey. I arrived in the town it was just as i imagined. Walk through the small streets. Enjoy the streetlife. Visit the fort and walk the streets. Take a few days to stay and think about the desert safari. You come to rest when you are out there.

title: Lovely city in the desert
review: A really nice old city with a rich history, behind the fort. The old area is the nicest area and there are plenty of hotels to choose from.

title: Great town to visit !
review: Lively town mostly within the the Golden Fort.  Narrow streets and alleyways all scream India with a background of old stone dwellings up against not-so-old shops, and the ever present drone of motorbikes.

title: Over-rated. Seen Agra and you've seen enough for Rajasthan
review: Not worth the extra travel expense and time unless your hobby is this area etc. If you've seen Agra and its surrounding tourist items, perhaps also Jaipur why travel all the way to Jaisalmer to see a run-down fort thats not really well maintained and another city in India with dirty smelly streets. Not my idea of a holiday. Don't be sold a dream by tourist industry blurb and brochures.

title: Incredible Unique City
review: It is like flying back in time! It is a very unique city with a fantastic "golden" architecture and walking the fort is just amazing!

title: Incredible desert outpost
review: This is an amazing place to come and visit - especially seeing the desert roll out from the parapets and imagining how isolated it must have felt when it was built, but for the trade routes passing through. Nowadays there are textiles and antiques shops but also a bustling market for the locals and a great mango juice bar. Do visit but also don't miss a camel safari out into the desert.

title: Spectacular City & Mesmerizing Desert Stay
review: Golden City it is!!! Jaisalmer takes you to the old golden era of Stone Architecture. Almost everything in this city is built with limestone. Even the normal houses looks royal and beautiful. Taking a stroll through the lanes and looking at the spectacular buildings is one of its kind experience.

title: Unique experience
review: I really enjoyed this city. Its unique, its different. The people were really nice and kind. The cultures and cuisines were awesome experience for me.

title: A special City
review: I really loved Jaisalmer.  Lavish Temples juxtaposition with simple platforms, outstanding Havelis with slums, intricate carvings with plain hewn stone all with the desert nearby.  Delightful smalls of sandalwood mingle with not so pleasant smells! A cultural overload.

title: Jaisalmer is an attractive desert city
review: This desert city has now become a major attraction for people not only across the world but Indian tourists as well!  Youngsters come here in hordes and head for sand dunes, which are about 40 kms away.  But this city itself has so much history, one needs to spend few days.

title: Historical City
review: This is very isolate area of Rajasthan but very historical city because city have very large fort, haveli, museums,jain temple, war memorial museum etc please do proper planing & visit this city

title: Desert City
review: This is the place to be if you are interested in exploring desert in India, having camel rides and enjoying the sunset. Excellent!

title: Inside a dream
review: Is like being inside a story of the 1001 nights. Is incredible to realize that this places are so alive.. full of nice people and small nooks to discover.

title: Like a dream
review: Jaisalmer is the most beautiful place!! One cannot visit India without spending time in Jaisalmer. It is just like a dream

title: Dream of 1001 nights
review: Unforgettable experience in Rajastan. Just walking around the old town of Jaisalmer and you have to think that you are living in a dream.

title: The Golden City
review: Another fascinating city in Rajasthan. Each city boasts a palace, fort and temples but they are very different. This is the golden city as all its houses and fort are built with the yellow stone.

title: Jaisalmet is good city to Visit
review: This is a very small city but a very good place to visit. Best time to visit this place is during winters. however stay aware that the guides they cheat you and take a lot of money from your for the tours and stays. Must visit place once in the life time.

title: The Golden City
review: Founded in 1156 A.D. and built of golden yellow sandstone this fort has remained inhabited ever since which makes it a living museum and so wonderful to visit
